factoid: Princess Mary roused herself.
Princess Mary felt appalled at what she had been thinking.
Princess Mary went into the room where the icons hung before going down.
Princess Mary's eyes were fixed on the dark face of a large icon of the Saviour lit by a lamp.
Princess Mary stood before the icon with folded hands for a few moments.
A painful doubt filled Princess Mary's soul.
Princess Mary wondered if the joy of love, of earthly love for a man, could be for her.
Princess Mary dreamed of happiness.
Princess Mary dreamed of children.
Princess Mary's strongest, most deeply hidden longing was for earthly love.
Princess Mary tried to hide this feeling from others.
Princess Mary tried to hide this feeling from herself.
The feeling grew stronger.
Princess Mary asked God how to stifle temptations of the devil.
Princess Mary asked God how to renounce vile fancies.
God gave Princess Mary the answer in her own heart.
Princess Mary was told to desire nothing for herself.
Princess Mary was told to seek nothing.
Princess Mary was told to be not anxious or envious.
Princess Mary was told that man's future and her own fate must remain hidden from her.
Princess Mary was told to live so that she may be ready for anything.
Princess Mary was told that if it be God's will to prove her in the duties of marriage, she should be ready to fulfill His will.
Princess Mary sighed with this consoling thought.
Princess Mary crossed herself.
Princess Mary went down.
Princess Mary did not think about her gown and coiffure.
Princess Mary did not think about how she would go in.
Princess Mary did not think about what she would say.
Princess Mary thought that none of those matters compared with the will of God.
Princess Mary believed that without God's care not a hair of man's head can fall.
